content.text:
I'm Claude Code, Anthropic's official CLI for Claude, ready to help you search and explore this codebase. I have access to powerful tools for finding files, searching content, and analyzing code.

I see you're working on **GolfGod** - a PGA Tour analytics platform built with Next.js 15, React 19, and Convex. I've reviewed the project context and understand:

- **Tech Stack**: Next.js + React + TypeScript + Convex + Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui
- **Database**: Convex with critical bandwidth constraints (1GB/month)
- **Key Tables**: `players` (~200), `courses` (~54), `tournamentResults` (20K+), `playerCourseStats`, etc.
- **Critical Rules**: Always use `.take(limit)`, never unbounded `.collect()`, use indexes for filtering
- **Current Status**: Recent commits include OAuth improvements and authentication UX fixes

I'm ready to help you with:
- **File search** using glob patterns and regex
- **Code analysis** and navigation
- **Architecture understanding**
- **Bug investigation**
- **Feature implementation**
- **Performance optimization** (especially bandwidth-aware Convex queries)

What would you like me to help you find or explore in the GolfGod codebase?

1→# GolfGod x Convex 🏌️‍♂️⚡
     2→
     3→> **Next-generation PGA Tour analytics platform** powered by real-time data and advanced player performance insights.
     4→
     5→[![Next.js 15](https://img.shields.io/badge/Next.js-15-black?logo=next.js)](https://nextjs.org/)
     6→[![React 19](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-19-blue?logo=react)](https://react.dev/)
     7→[![Convex](https://img.shields.io/badge/Convex-Realtime-orange)](https://convex.dev/)
     8→[![TypeScript](https://img.shields.io/badge/TypeScript-5.0-blue?logo=typescript)](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
     9→[![Tailwind CSS](https://img.shields.io/badge/Tailwind-4.0-38bdf8?logo=tailwind-css)](https://tailwindcss.com/)
    10→
    11→---
    12→
    13→## ✨ Features
    14→
    15→### 🎯 **Inside the Ropes** - Course-Specific Player Intelligence
    16→Deep-dive analytics revealing how players perform at specific golf courses:
    17→- **Tournament-by-Tournament History**: Complete performance records at each venue
    18→- **Course Performance Metrics**: Scoring averages, best/worst rounds, cut percentages
    19→- **Round-by-Round Analysis**: Average scores by round (R1, R2, R3, R4)
    20→- **Weekend vs Early Scoring**: Performance comparison between early rounds and weekend play
    21→- **Career Statistics**: Wins, top-10s, top-25s, total earnings at each course
    22→
    23→### 📊 **Core Analytics**
    24→- **Player Profiles**: Comprehensive bios, photos, career statistics
    25→- **Tournament Database**: 20,745+ tournament results across 200+ players
    26→- **Real-time Rankings**: PGA Tour world rankings and player follows
    27→- **Advanced Filtering**: Searchable dropdowns with type-to-filter functionality
    28→- **Historical Data**: Multi-year tournament histories from 2015-2026
    29→
    30→### 🚀 **Technical Excellence**
    31→- **Real-time Database**: Convex for instant data synchronization
    32→- **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript implementation
    33→- **Modern UI**: shadcn/ui component library with Tailwind CSS
    34→- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first, works beautifully on all devices
    35→- **Performance Optimized**: Sub-second page loads, efficient queries
    36→
    37→---
    38→
    39→## 🏁 Quick Start
    40→
    41→```bash
    42→# 1. Install dependencies
    43→bun install
    44→
    45→# 2. Set up Convex
    46→bunx convex dev
    47→
    48→# 3. Start development server
    49→bun run dev
    50→```
    51→
    52→Visit `http://localhost:3000` and explore the platform!
    53→
    54→---
    55→
    56→## 🛠️ Tech Stack
    57→
    58→| Category | Technology | Purpose |
    59→|----------|------------|---------|
    60→| **Framework** | [Next.js 15](https://nextjs.org/) | React framework with App Router |
    61→| **UI Library** | [React 19](https://react.dev/) | Modern React with Server Components |
    62→| **Database** | [Convex](https://convex.dev/) | Real-time backend-as-a-service |
    63→| **Styling** | [Tailwind CSS 4.0](https://tailwindcss.com/) | Utility-first CSS framework |
    64→| **Components** | [shadcn/ui](https://ui.shadcn.com/) | Beautiful, accessible UI components |
    65→| **Language** | [TypeScript 5.0](https://www.typescriptlang.org/) | Type-safe JavaScript |
    66→| **Forms** | [react-select](https://react-select.com/) | Advanced searchable dropdowns |
    67→| **Icons** | [lucide-react](https://lucide.dev/) | Modern icon library |
    68→| **Package Manager** | [Bun](https://bun.sh/) | Ultra-fast JavaScript runtime |
    69→
    70→---
    71→
    72→## 📁 Project Structure
    73→
    74→```
    75→golfgod_x_convex/
    76→├── app/                          # Next.js App Router pages
    77→│   ├── inside-the-ropes/         # Course-specific player analytics
    78→│   ├── tournaments/pga/          # Tournament browsing & results
    79→│   └── api/                      # API routes (imports, JSON handling)
    80→├── components/                    # React components
    81→│   ├── layout/                   # Dashboard, navigation
    82→│   └── ui/                       # shadcn/ui & custom components
    83→├── convex/                       # Convex backend
    84→│   ├── schema.ts                 # Database schema (9 tables)
    85→│   ├── courseStats.ts            # Course analytics queries
    86→│   ├── players.ts                # Player data queries
    87→│   ├── importMasterData.ts       # Batch data import pipeline
    88→│   └── _generated/               # Convex auto-generated types
    89→├── docs/                         # Documentation
    90→│   ├── INSIDE_THE_ROPES.md      # Feature methodology
    91→│   ├── DATABASE_SCHEMA.md        # Schema diagrams
    92→│   └── admin/                    # Admin guides
    93→└── scripts/                      # Data import scripts
    94→```
    95→
    96→---
    97→
    98→## 🎯 Inside the Ropes: How It Works
    99→
   100→**Inside the Ropes** provides unprecedented insight into player performance at specific golf courses by analyzing historical tournament results.
   101→
   102→### Data Model
   103→
   104→#### 1️⃣ **Course Mapping**
   105→Each PGA Tour event is mapped to its host course:
   106→- **TPC Sawgrass** → THE PLAYERS Championship
   107→- **Augusta National** → Masters Tournament
   108→- **Pebble Beach Golf Links** → AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am
   109→
   110→#### 2️⃣ **Performance Aggregation**
   111→For each player-course combination, we calculate:
   112→
   113→```typescript
   114→// Example: Scottie Scheffler at TPC Sawgrass
   115→{
   116→  roundsPlayed: 24,          // Total rounds at this course
   117→  scoringAverage: 69.8,      // Average score per round
   118→  bestScore: 64,             // Career best round
   119→  worstScore: 74,            // Career worst round
   120→  cutsPlayed: 6,             // Tournaments entered
   121→  cutsMade: 6,               // Tournaments where cut was made
   122→  wins: 2,                   // Tournament victories
   123→  top10s: 5,                 // Top-10 finishes
   124→  top25s: 6,                 // Top-25 finishes
   125→  totalEarnings: 8450000,    // Career earnings at course
   126→  avgR1Score: 70.2,          // Average Round 1 score
   127→  avgR2Score: 69.5,          // Average Round 2 score
   128→  avgR3Score: 69.3,          // Average Round 3 score
   129→  avgR4Score: 70.0,          // Average Round 4 score
   130→  avgEarlyScore: 69.85,      // Average Rounds 1-2 score
   131→  avgWeekendScore: 69.65     // Average Rounds 3-4 score
   132→}
   133→```
   134→
   135→#### 3️⃣ **Tournament History**
   136→Complete tournament-by-tournament breakdown:
   137→
   138→| Year | Tournament | Position | Scorecard | To Par | Earnings |
   139→|------|-----------|----------|-----------|--------|----------|
   140→| 2024 | THE PLAYERS | 1 | 67-70-69-67 | -15 | $4,500,000 |
   141→| 2023 | THE PLAYERS | T-3 | 69-68-71-70 | -10 | $850,000 |
   142→| 2022 | THE PLAYERS | MC | 74-72 | +2 | $0 |
   143→
   144→#### 4️⃣ **Missed Cut Detection**
   145→Smart logic identifies missed cuts:
   146→- Position field contains "MC", "CUT", or "WD"
   147→- Only 2 rounds played (didn't qualify for weekend)
   148→- "Unknown" position + 2 rounds = missed cut
   149→
   150→### Technical Implementation
   151→
   152→**Backend Query**: `convex/courseStats.ts`
   153→```typescript
   154→export const getPlayerTournamentHistoryAtCourse = query({
   155→  args: {
   156→    playerId: v.id("players"),
   157→    courseId: v.id("courses"),
   158→  },
   159→  handler: async (ctx, args) => {
   160→    // Get course details
   161→    const course = await ctx.db.get(args.courseId);
   162→
   163→    // Find all tournament results at this course
   164→    const results = await ctx.db
   165→      .query("tournamentResults")
   166→      .withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", args.playerId))
   167→      .filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("course"), course.name))
   168→      .collect();
   169→
   170→    // Sort by year, format scorecard, detect missed cuts
   171→    return sortedResults.map(formatResult);
   172→  },
   173→});
   174→```
   175→
   176→**Frontend Component**: `app/inside-the-ropes/page.tsx`
   177→- **SearchableSelect** for players: Type to filter 200+ players
   178→- **SearchableSelect** for courses: Type to filter golf courses
   179→- **Tabs Interface**: Switch between Course Stats and Tournament History
   180→- **Responsive Tables**: Mobile-friendly data presentation
   181→
   182→---
   183→
   184→## 🗄️ Database Schema
   185→
   186→### Core Tables (9 Total)
   187→
   188→#### **players** - Player profiles and metadata
   189→```typescript
   190→{
   191→  _id: Id<"players">,
   192→  name: string,                    // "Scottie Scheffler"
   193→  espnId?: string,                 // ESPN athlete ID
   194→  country?: string,                // "United States"
   195→  countryCode?: string,            // "USA"
   196→  worldRanking?: number,           // 1
   197→  birthDate?: string,              // "1996-06-21"
   198→  birthPlace?: string,             // "Ridgewood, New Jersey"
   199→  college?: string,                // "University of Texas"
   200→  swing?: "Right" | "Left",        // "Right"
   201→  turnedPro?: number,              // 2018
   202→  height?: string,                 // "6'3\""
   203→  weight?: string,                 // "215 lbs"
   204→  photoUrl?: string                // Profile image URL
   205→}
   206→```
   207→
   208→#### **courses** - Golf course information
   209→```typescript
   210→{
   211→  _id: Id<"courses">,
   212→  name: string,                    // "TPC Sawgrass"
   213→  location: string,                // "Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida"
   214→  par: number,                     // 72
   215→  yardage?: number,                // 7245
   216→  established?: number,            // 1980
   217→  designer?: string,               // "Pete Dye"
   218→  type?: string,                   // "Stadium"
   219→  grassType?: string,              // "Bermuda"
   220→  stimpmeter?: number              // Green speed
   221→}
   222→```
   223→
   224→#### **tournamentResults** - Historical performance data
   225→```typescript
   226→{
   227→  _id: Id<"tournamentResults">,
   228→  playerId: Id<"players">,         // Player reference
   229→  tournament: string,              // "THE PLAYERS Championship"
   230→  year: number,                    // 2024
   231→  course?: string,                 // "TPC Sawgrass"
   232→  position: string,                // "1" or "T-3" or "MC"
   233→  scores?: string[],               // ["67", "70", "69", "67"]
   234→  totalScore?: number,             // 273
   235→  toPar?: string,                  // "-15"
   236→  earnings?: number                // 4500000
   237→}
   238→```
   239→
   240→#### **playerCourseStats** - Aggregated course performance
   241→```typescript
   242→{
   243→  _id: Id<"playerCourseStats">,
   244→  playerId: Id<"players">,
   245→  courseId: Id<"courses">,
   246→  roundsPlayed: number,            // 24
   247→  scoringAverage: number,          // 69.8
   248→  bestScore: number,               // 64
   249→  worstScore: number,              // 74
   250→  cutsPlayed: number,              // 6
   251→  cutsMade: number,                // 6
   252→  wins: number,                    // 2
   253→  top10s: number,                  // 5
   254→  top25s: number,                  // 6
   255→  totalEarnings: number,           // 8450000
   256→  avgR1Score?: number,             // 70.2
   257→  avgR2Score?: number,             // 69.5
   258→  avgR3Score?: number,             // 69.3
   259→  avgR4Score?: number,             // 70.0
   260→  avgEarlyScore?: number,          // 69.85
   261→  avgWeekendScore?: number,        // 69.65
   262→  lastUpdated: number,             // Timestamp
   263→  lastTournamentYear: number       // 2024
   264→}
   265→```
   266→
   267→#### **tournamentCourses** - Tournament-to-course mapping
   268→```typescript
   269→{
   270→  _id: Id<"tournamentCourses">,
   271→  tournamentName: string,          // "THE PLAYERS Championship"
   272→  courseId: Id<"courses">,         // Reference to TPC Sawgrass
   273→  yearStart: number,               // 1982
   274→  yearEnd?: number,                // undefined (still current)
   275→  isPrimary: boolean               // true
   276→}
   277→```
   278→
   279→### Supporting Tables
   280→- **pgaTournaments**: Tournament metadata (name, year, winner, purse, dates)
   281→- **roundStats**: Individual round statistics (fairways, greens, putts)
   282→- **playerStats**: Annual player statistics (SG:Total, driving distance, etc.)
   283→- **userFollows**: User-player follow relationships (requires auth)
   284→
   285→---
   286→
   287→## 💻 Development
   288→
   289→### Prerequisites
   290→- **Node.js** 18+ or **Bun** 1.0+
   291→- **Convex Account** (free at [convex.dev](https://convex.dev))
   292→
   293→### Local Setup
   294→
   295→```bash
   296→# Clone repository
   297→git clone https://github.com/yourusername/golfgod_x_convex.git
   298→cd golfgod_x_convex
   299→
   300→# Install dependencies
   301→bun install
   302→
   303→# Initialize Convex (first time only)
   304→bunx convex dev
   305→
   306→# Start development server
   307→bun run dev
   308→```
   309→
   310→### Available Scripts
   311→
   312→```bash
   313→bun run dev          # Start Next.js dev server (localhost:3000)
   314→bun run build        # Build for production
   315→bun run start        # Start production server
   316→bun run lint         # Run ESLint
   317→bunx convex dev      # Start Convex development backend
   318→bunx convex deploy   # Deploy Convex backend to production
   319→```
   320→
   321→### Environment Variables
   322→
   323→Create `.env.local`:
   324→```bash
   325→# Convex
   326→NEXT_PUBLIC_CONVEX_URL=https://your-deployment.convex.cloud
   327→
   328→# Optional: Authentication (if using Convex Auth)
   329→# CONVEX_AUTH_SECRET=your-secret-key
   330→```
   331→
   332→### Common Development Tasks
   333→
   334→#### Seed Popular Courses
   335→```typescript
   336→// In Convex dashboard, run:
   337→await api.courseStats.seedPopularCourses()
   338→```
   339→
   340→#### Import Master Data (200 players, 20,745 tournaments)
   341→```bash
   342→# Via API route
   343→POST http://localhost:3000/api/import-json-files
   344→```
   345→
   346→#### Calculate Player Course Stats
   347→```typescript
   348→// In Convex dashboard, run:
   349→await api.courseStats.calculatePlayerCourseStats({
   350→  playerId: "playerIdHere",
   351→  courseId: "courseIdHere",
   352→  tournamentName: "THE PLAYERS Championship"
   353→})
   354→```
   355→
   356→### Debugging Tips
   357→
   358→**Issue: "Unknown" course locations in dropdown**
   359→- **Cause**: Master JSON has `course_location: null`
   360→- **Fix**: Either hide subtitle when "Unknown" or manually update course locations
   361→
   362→**Issue: Missed cuts showing in scorecard column**
   363→- **Fix**: Already resolved in `courseStats.ts:87-109` and `page.tsx:231-252`
   364→
   365→**Issue: Convex queries not updating**
   366→- **Solution**: Check Convex dashboard logs, ensure indexes are built
   367→
   368→---
   369→
   370→## 📥 Data Import Pipeline
   371→
   372→### Architecture
   373→
   374→```
   375→Master JSON Files (scripts/)
   376→    ↓
   377→API Route (/api/import-json-files)
   378→    ↓
   379→Convex Action (importMasterData.ts)
   380→    ↓
   381→Batch Processing (100 players at a time)
   382→    ↓
   383→Database Tables (players, courses, tournamentResults, etc.)
   384→```
   385→
   386→### Import Process
   387→
   388→1. **Source Files**: `scripts/master_data_batch_*.json`
   389→   - 200 players across 2 batch files
   390→   - 20,745 tournament results (2015-2026)
   391→   - Course data with variants (Stadium, Links, Parkland)
   392→
   393→2. **Processing Logic**:
   394→   - **Players**: Check by name, insert if new, update if exists
   395→   - **Courses**: Check by name, insert if new (location defaults to "Unknown")
   396→   - **Tournament Results**: Batch insert 100 at a time for performance
   397→   - **Deduplication**: Automatic via name/espnId matching
   398→
   399→3. **Performance**:
   400→   - ~30-60 seconds for full import
   401→   - Batched operations prevent timeout
   402→   - Convex handles transactional consistency
   403→
   404→4. **Data Quality**:
   405→   - ✅ Player names, countries, ESPN IDs
   406→   - ✅ Tournament results, positions, earnings
   407→   - ✅ Round-by-round scores
   408→   - ⚠️ Course locations (need manual enrichment)
   409→   - ⚠️ Course par/yardage (defaults to 72/undefined)
   410→
   411→---
   412→
   413→## 🤝 Contributing
   414→
   415→We welcome contributions! Here's how to get started:
   416→
   417→### Development Workflow
   418→
   419→1. **Fork the repository**
   420→2. **Create a feature branch**
   421→   ```bash
   422→   git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature
   423→   ```
   424→3. **Make your changes**
   425→   - Follow TypeScript best practices
   426→   - Use existing component patterns
   427→   - Add comments for complex logic
   428→4. **Test thoroughly**
   429→   - Manual testing in browser
   430→   - Check Convex query performance
   431→   - Verify mobile responsiveness
   432→5. **Commit with clear messages**
   433→   ```bash
   434→   git commit -m "Add course performance trend charts"
   435→   ```
   436→6. **Push and create Pull Request**
   437→   ```bash
   438→   git push origin feature/amazing-feature
   439→   ```
   440→
   441→### Code Style
   442→
   443→- **TypeScript**: Strict mode enabled, no `any` types
   444→- **Components**: Functional components with hooks
   445→- **Convex**: Use typed validators (`v.string()`, `v.id()`)
   446→- **Styling**: Tailwind utility classes, shadcn/ui components
   447→- **Naming**: camelCase for variables, PascalCase for components
   448→
   449→### Areas for Contribution
   450→
   451→- 🎨 **UI/UX Enhancements**: Better charts, visualizations, mobile experience
   452→- 📊 **Advanced Analytics**: Strokes Gained data, weather correlations
   453→- 🔍 **Search Improvements**: Fuzzy search, autocomplete, filters
   454→- 🗺️ **Course Data**: Enrich course locations, par, yardage, designers
   455→- 📱 **Mobile App**: React Native version with shared Convex backend
   456→- 🧪 **Testing**: Unit tests, E2E tests, performance benchmarks
   457→
   458→---
   459→
   460→## 📚 Documentation
   461→
   462→- [Inside the Ropes Methodology](docs/INSIDE_THE_ROPES.md)
   463→- [Database Schema Reference](docs/DATABASE_SCHEMA.md)
   464→- [Development Guide](docs/DEVELOPMENT.md)
   465→- [Data Management](docs/admin/data-management.md)
   466→- [API Documentation](docs/api/)
   467→
   468→---
   469→
   470→## 📄 License
   471→
   472→MIT License - feel free to use this project for learning or building your own golf analytics platform!
   473→
   474→---
   475→
   476→## 🙏 Acknowledgments
   477→
   478→- **PGA Tour** for the incredible sport and data
   479→- **Convex** for the amazing real-time backend platform
   480→- **Vercel** for Next.js and deployment infrastructure

# GolfGod x Convex 🏌️‍♂️⚡

> **Next-generation PGA Tour analytics platform** powered by real-time data and advanced player performance insights.

[![Next.js 15](https://img.shields.io/badge/Next.js-15-black?logo=next.js)](https://nextjs.org/)
[![React 19](https://img.shields.io/badge/React-19-blue?logo=react)](https://react.dev/)
[![Convex](https://img.shields.io/badge/Convex-Realtime-orange)](https://convex.dev/)
[![TypeScript](https://img.shields.io/badge/TypeScript-5.0-blue?logo=typescript)](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
[![Tailwind CSS](https://img.shields.io/badge/Tailwind-4.0-38bdf8?logo=tailwind-css)](https://tailwindcss.com/)

---

## ✨ Features

### 🎯 **Inside the Ropes** - Course-Specific Player Intelligence
Deep-dive analytics revealing how players perform at specific golf courses:
- **Tournament-by-Tournament History**: Complete performance records at each venue
- **Course Performance Metrics**: Scoring averages, best/worst rounds, cut percentages
- **Round-by-Round Analysis**: Average scores by round (R1, R2, R3, R4)
- **Weekend vs Early Scoring**: Performance comparison between early rounds and weekend play
- **Career Statistics**: Wins, top-10s, top-25s, total earnings at each course

### 📊 **Core Analytics**
- **Player Profiles**: Comprehensive bios, photos, career statistics
- **Tournament Database**: 20,745+ tournament results across 200+ players
- **Real-time Rankings**: PGA Tour world rankings and player follows
- **Advanced Filtering**: Searchable dropdowns with type-to-filter functionality
- **Historical Data**: Multi-year tournament histories from 2015-2026

### 🚀 **Technical Excellence**
- **Real-time Database**: Convex for instant data synchronization
- **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript implementation
- **Modern UI**: shadcn/ui component library with Tailwind CSS
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first, works beautifully on all devices
- **Performance Optimized**: Sub-second page loads, efficient queries

---

## 🏁 Quick Start

```bash
# 1. Install dependencies
bun install

# 2. Set up Convex
bunx convex dev

# 3. Start development server
bun run dev
```

Visit `http://localhost:3000` and explore the platform!

---

## 🛠️ Tech Stack

| Category | Technology | Purpose |
|----------|------------|---------|
| **Framework** | [Next.js 15](https://nextjs.org/) | React framework with App Router |
| **UI Library** | [React 19](https://react.dev/) | Modern React with Server Components |
| **Database** | [Convex](https://convex.dev/) | Real-time backend-as-a-service |
| **Styling** | [Tailwind CSS 4.0](https://tailwindcss.com/) | Utility-first CSS framework |
| **Components** | [shadcn/ui](https://ui.shadcn.com/) | Beautiful, accessible UI components |
| **Language** | [TypeScript 5.0](https://www.typescriptlang.org/) | Type-safe JavaScript |
| **Forms** | [react-select](https://react-select.com/) | Advanced searchable dropdowns |
| **Icons** | [lucide-react](https://lucide.dev/) | Modern icon library |
| **Package Manager** | [Bun](https://bun.sh/) | Ultra-fast JavaScript runtime |

---

## 📁 Project Structure

```
golfgod_x_convex/
├── app/                          # Next.js App Router pages
│   ├── inside-the-ropes/         # Course-specific player analytics
│   ├── tournaments/pga/          # Tournament browsing & results
│   └── api/                      # API routes (imports, JSON handling)
├── components/                    # React components
│   ├── layout/                   # Dashboard, navigation
│   └── ui/                       # shadcn/ui & custom components
├── convex/                       # Convex backend
│   ├── schema.ts                 # Database schema (9 tables)
│   ├── courseStats.ts            # Course analytics queries
│   ├── players.ts                # Player data queries
│   ├── importMasterData.ts       # Batch data import pipeline
│   └── _generated/               # Convex auto-generated types
├── docs/                         # Documentation
│   ├── INSIDE_THE_ROPES.md      # Feature methodology
│   ├── DATABASE_SCHEMA.md        # Schema diagrams
│   └── admin/                    # Admin guides
└── scripts/                      # Data import scripts
```

---

## 🎯 Inside the Ropes: How It Works

**Inside the Ropes** provides unprecedented insight into player performance at specific golf courses by analyzing historical tournament results.

### Data Model

#### 1️⃣ **Course Mapping**
Each PGA Tour event is mapped to its host course:
- **TPC Sawgrass** → THE PLAYERS Championship
- **Augusta National** → Masters Tournament
- **Pebble Beach Golf Links** → AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am

#### 2️⃣ **Performance Aggregation**
For each player-course combination, we calculate:

```typescript
// Example: Scottie Scheffler at TPC Sawgrass
{
  roundsPlayed: 24,          // Total rounds at this course
  scoringAverage: 69.8,      // Average score per round
  bestScore: 64,             // Career best round
  worstScore: 74,            // Career worst round
  cutsPlayed: 6,             // Tournaments entered
  cutsMade: 6,               // Tournaments where cut was made
  wins: 2,                   // Tournament victories
  top10s: 5,                 // Top-10 finishes
  top25s: 6,                 // Top-25 finishes
  totalEarnings: 8450000,    // Career earnings at course
  avgR1Score: 70.2,          // Average Round 1 score
  avgR2Score: 69.5,          // Average Round 2 score
  avgR3Score: 69.3,          // Average Round 3 score
  avgR4Score: 70.0,          // Average Round 4 score
  avgEarlyScore: 69.85,      // Average Rounds 1-2 score
  avgWeekendScore: 69.65     // Average Rounds 3-4 score
}
```

#### 3️⃣ **Tournament History**
Complete tournament-by-tournament breakdown:

| Year | Tournament | Position | Scorecard | To Par | Earnings |
|------|-----------|----------|-----------|--------|----------|
| 2024 | THE PLAYERS | 1 | 67-70-69-67 | -15 | $4,500,000 |
| 2023 | THE PLAYERS | T-3 | 69-68-71-70 | -10 | $850,000 |
| 2022 | THE PLAYERS | MC | 74-72 | +2 | $0 |

#### 4️⃣ **Missed Cut Detection**
Smart logic identifies missed cuts:
- Position field contains "MC", "CUT", or "WD"
- Only 2 rounds played (didn't qualify for weekend)
- "Unknown" position + 2 rounds = missed cut

### Technical Implementation

**Backend Query**: `convex/courseStats.ts`
```typescript
export const getPlayerTournamentHistoryAtCourse = query({
  args: {
    playerId: v.id("players"),
    courseId: v.id("courses"),
  },
  handler: async (ctx, args) => {
    // Get course details
    const course = await ctx.db.get(args.courseId);

    // Find all tournament results at this course
    const results = await ctx.db
      .query("tournamentResults")
      .withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", args.playerId))
      .filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("course"), course.name))
      .collect();

    // Sort by year, format scorecard, detect missed cuts
    return sortedResults.map(formatResult);
  },
});
```

**Frontend Component**: `app/inside-the-ropes/page.tsx`
- **SearchableSelect** for players: Type to filter 200+ players
- **SearchableSelect** for courses: Type to filter golf courses
- **Tabs Interface**: Switch between Course Stats and Tournament History
- **Responsive Tables**: Mobile-friendly data presentation

---

## 🗄️ Database Schema

### Core Tables (9 Total)

#### **players** - Player profiles and metadata
```typescript
{
  _id: Id<"players">,
  name: string,                    // "Scottie Scheffler"
  espnId?: string,                 // ESPN athlete ID
  country?: string,                // "United States"
  countryCode?: string,            // "USA"
  worldRanking?: number,           // 1
  birthDate?: string,              // "1996-06-21"
  birthPlace?: string,             // "Ridgewood, New Jersey"
  college?: string,                // "University of Texas"
  swing?: "Right" | "Left",        // "Right"
  turnedPro?: number,              // 2018
  height?: string,                 // "6'3\""
  weight?: string,                 // "215 lbs"
  photoUrl?: string                // Profile image URL
}
```

#### **courses** - Golf course information
```typescript
{
  _id: Id<"courses">,
  name: string,                    // "TPC Sawgrass"
  location: string,                // "Ponte Vedra Beach, Florida"
  par: number,                     // 72
  yardage?: number,                // 7245
  established?: number,            // 1980
  designer?: string,               // "Pete Dye"
  type?: string,                   // "Stadium"
  grassType?: string,              // "Bermuda"
  stimpmeter?: number              // Green speed
}
```

#### **tournamentResults** - Historical performance data
```typescript
{
  _id: Id<"tournamentResults">,
  playerId: Id<"players">,         // Player reference
  tournament: string,              // "THE PLAYERS Championship"
  year: number,                    // 2024
  course?: string,                 // "TPC Sawgrass"
  position: string,                // "1" or "T-3" or "MC"
  scores?: string[],               // ["67", "70", "69", "67"]
  totalScore?: number,             // 273
  toPar?: string,                  // "-15"
  earnings?: number                // 4500000
}
```

#### **playerCourseStats** - Aggregated course performance
```typescript
{
  _id: Id<"playerCourseStats">,
  playerId: Id<"players">,
  courseId: Id<"courses">,
  roundsPlayed: number,            // 24
  scoringAverage: number,          // 69.8
  bestScore: number,               // 64
  worstScore: number,              // 74
  cutsPlayed: number,              // 6
  cutsMade: number,                // 6
  wins: number,                    // 2
  top10s: number,                  // 5
  top25s: number,                  // 6
  totalEarnings: number,           // 8450000
  avgR1Score?: number,             // 70.2
  avgR2Score?: number,             // 69.5
  avgR3Score?: number,             // 69.3
  avgR4Score?: number,             // 70.0
  avgEarlyScore?: number,          // 69.85
  avgWeekendScore?: number,        // 69.65
  lastUpdated: number,             // Timestamp
  lastTournamentYear: number       // 2024
}
```

#### **tournamentCourses** - Tournament-to-course mapping
```typescript
{
  _id: Id<"tournamentCourses">,
  tournamentName: string,          // "THE PLAYERS Championship"
  courseId: Id<"courses">,         // Reference to TPC Sawgrass
  yearStart: number,               // 1982
  yearEnd?: number,                // undefined (still current)
  isPrimary: boolean               // true
}
```

### Supporting Tables
- **pgaTournaments**: Tournament metadata (name, year, winner, purse, dates)
- **roundStats**: Individual round statistics (fairways, greens, putts)
- **playerStats**: Annual player statistics (SG:Total, driving distance, etc.)
- **userFollows**: User-player follow relationships (requires auth)

---

## 💻 Development

### Prerequisites
- **Node.js** 18+ or **Bun** 1.0+
- **Convex Account** (free at [convex.dev](https://convex.dev))

### Local Setup

```bash
# Clone repository
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/golfgod_x_convex.git
cd golfgod_x_convex

# Install dependencies
bun install

# Initialize Convex (first time only)
bunx convex dev

# Start development server
bun run dev
```

### Available Scripts

```bash
bun run dev          # Start Next.js dev server (localhost:3000)
bun run build        # Build for production
bun run start        # Start production server
bun run lint         # Run ESLint
bunx convex dev      # Start Convex development backend
bunx convex deploy   # Deploy Convex backend to production
```

### Environment Variables

Create `.env.local`:
```bash
# Convex
NEXT_PUBLIC_CONVEX_URL=https://your-deployment.convex.cloud

# Optional: Authentication (if using Convex Auth)
# CONVEX_AUTH_SECRET=your-secret-key
```

### Common Development Tasks

#### Seed Popular Courses
```typescript
// In Convex dashboard, run:
await api.courseStats.seedPopularCourses()
```

#### Import Master Data (200 players, 20,745 tournaments)
```bash
# Via API route
POST http://localhost:3000/api/import-json-files
```

#### Calculate Player Course Stats
```typescript
// In Convex dashboard, run:
await api.courseStats.calculatePlayerCourseStats({
  playerId: "playerIdHere",
  courseId: "courseIdHere",
  tournamentName: "THE PLAYERS Championship"
})
```

### Debugging Tips

**Issue: "Unknown" course locations in dropdown**
- **Cause**: Master JSON has `course_location: null`
- **Fix**: Either hide subtitle when "Unknown" or manually update course locations

**Issue: Missed cuts showing in scorecard column**
- **Fix**: Already resolved in `courseStats.ts:87-109` and `page.tsx:231-252`

**Issue: Convex queries not updating**
- **Solution**: Check Convex dashboard logs, ensure indexes are built

---

## 📥 Data Import Pipeline

### Architecture

```
Master JSON Files (scripts/)
    ↓
API Route (/api/import-json-files)
    ↓
Convex Action (importMasterData.ts)
    ↓
Batch Processing (100 players at a time)
    ↓
Database Tables (players, courses, tournamentResults, etc.)
```

### Import Process

1. **Source Files**: `scripts/master_data_batch_*.json`
   - 200 players across 2 batch files
   - 20,745 tournament results (2015-2026)
   - Course data with variants (Stadium, Links, Parkland)

2. **Processing Logic**:
   - **Players**: Check by name, insert if new, update if exists
   - **Courses**: Check by name, insert if new (location defaults to "Unknown")
   - **Tournament Results**: Batch insert 100 at a time for performance
   - **Deduplication**: Automatic via name/espnId matching

3. **Performance**:
   - ~30-60 seconds for full import
   - Batched operations prevent timeout
   - Convex handles transactional consistency

4. **Data Quality**:
   - ✅ Player names, countries, ESPN IDs
   - ✅ Tournament results, positions, earnings
   - ✅ Round-by-round scores
   - ⚠️ Course locations (need manual enrichment)
   - ⚠️ Course par/yardage (defaults to 72/undefined)

---

## 🤝 Contributing

We welcome contributions! Here's how to get started:

### Development Workflow

1. **Fork the repository**
2. **Create a feature branch**
   ```bash
   git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature
   ```
3. **Make your changes**
   - Follow TypeScript best practices
   - Use existing component patterns
   - Add comments for complex logic
4. **Test thoroughly**
   - Manual testing in browser
   - Check Convex query performance
   - Verify mobile responsiveness
5. **Commit with clear messages**
   ```bash
   git commit -m "Add course performance trend charts"
   ```
6. **Push and create Pull Request**
   ```bash
   git push origin feature/amazing-feature
   ```

### Code Style

- **TypeScript**: Strict mode enabled, no `any` types
- **Components**: Functional components with hooks
- **Convex**: Use typed validators (`v.string()`, `v.id()`)
- **Styling**: Tailwind utility classes, shadcn/ui components
- **Naming**: camelCase for variables, PascalCase for components

### Areas for Contribution

- 🎨 **UI/UX Enhancements**: Better charts, visualizations, mobile experience
- 📊 **Advanced Analytics**: Strokes Gained data, weather correlations
- 🔍 **Search Improvements**: Fuzzy search, autocomplete, filters
- 🗺️ **Course Data**: Enrich course locations, par, yardage, designers
- 📱 **Mobile App**: React Native version with shared Convex backend
- 🧪 **Testing**: Unit tests, E2E tests, performance benchmarks

---

- [Inside the Ropes Methodology](docs/INSIDE_THE_ROPES.md)

**Built with ❤️ by golf fans, for golf fans** 🏌️‍♂️

1→# GolfGod Database Relationship Map
     2→
     3→**Single Source of Truth** for database schema, relationships, and query patterns.
     4→
     5→---
     6→
     7→## 🎯 Quick Schema Overview (30 seconds)
     8→
     9→```
    10→Players (200) → Tournament Results (20K+) → Round Stats (future)
    11→   ↓                    ↓                        ↓
    12→   └─────────→ Player Course Stats (aggregated career data)
    13→                        ↑
    14→Courses (54) ──────────┘
    15→```
    16→
    17→**Key Principle**: Data exists at 3 levels of granularity
    18→1. **Raw** → `tournamentResults` (single tournament, aggregate score)
    19→2. **Detailed** → `roundStats` (individual rounds with tee times)
    20→3. **Aggregated** → `playerCourseStats` (career stats at course)
    21→
    22→---
    23→
    24→## 📊 Entity Flow Diagram
    25→
    26→```
    27→┌─────────┐
    28→│ players │ (200 records)
    29→└────┬────┘
    30→     │
    31→     ├──→ tournamentResults (playerId) [20K+ records]
    32→     │    │
    33→     │    ├─ Stores: year, tournament, position, scores[], toPar, earnings
    34→     │    │
    35→     │    └──→ roundStats (tournamentResultId) [future: 80K+ records]
    36→     │         └─ Stores: round (1-4), score, toPar, teeTime (AM/PM)
    37→     │
    38→     └──→ playerCourseStats (playerId) [2.7K records]
    39→          └─ Stores: AGGREGATED career stats at course
    40→
    41→┌─────────┐
    42→│ courses │ (54 records)
    43→└────┬────┘
    44→     │
    45→     ├──→ tournamentCourses (courseId) [mapping table]
    46→     │    └─ Maps: tournamentName ↔ courseId ↔ yearRange
    47→     │
    48→     ├──→ tournamentResults (course field - string)
    49→     │    └─ Links tournaments to courses
    50→     │
    51→     ├──→ roundStats (courseId)
    52→     │
    53→     └──→ playerCourseStats (courseId)
    54→          └─ One record per player-course combination
    55→
    56→┌──────────────────┐
    57→│ pgaTournaments   │ (tournament schedule 2015-2026)
    58→└──────────────────┘
    59→     └─ Standalone: Schedule, winners, prize money
    60→```
    61→
    62→---
    63→
    64→## 🔗 Table Connections (Parent → Child)
    65→
    66→### **players**
    67→```
    68→players
    69→├── tournamentResults (FK: playerId)
    70→│   └── Contains: All tournament results for this player
    71→├── roundStats (FK: playerId)
    72→│   └── Contains: All individual rounds played
    73→├── playerCourseStats (FK: playerId)
    74→│   └── Contains: Aggregated stats at each course
    75→└── userFollows (FK: playerId)
    76→    └── Contains: Users following this player
    77→```
    78→
    79→### **courses**
    80→```
    81→courses
    82→├── tournamentCourses (FK: courseId)
    83→│   └── Contains: Tournament-to-course mappings
    84→├── tournamentResults (field: course - string match)
    85→│   └── Contains: Results at this course
    86→├── roundStats (FK: courseId)
    87→│   └── Contains: All rounds played at this course
    88→└── playerCourseStats (FK: courseId)
    89→    └── Contains: All player stats at this course
    90→```
    91→
    92→### **tournamentResults**
    93→```
    94→tournamentResults
    95→└── roundStats (FK: tournamentResultId)
    96→    └── Contains: Round-by-round breakdown of this result
    97→```
    98→
    99→---
   100→
   101→## 🎯 Query Patterns by Use Case
   102→
   103→### **Use Case 1: Inside the Ropes - Player Course Stats**
   104→**Goal**: Show Scottie Scheffler's career stats at TPC Scottsdale
   105→
   106→```typescript
   107→// Step 1: Get aggregated career stats (FASTEST)
   108→const stats = await ctx.db
   109→  .query("playerCourseStats")
   110→  .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
   111→    q.eq("playerId", scottieId).eq("courseId", tpcScottsdaleId)
   112→  )
   113→  .first();
   114→
   115→// Returns: { scoringAverage, roundsPlayed, wins, top10s, cutsMade, etc. }
   116→```
   117→
   118→**Why this table?** Pre-aggregated career stats, single record, instant response.
   119→
   120→### **Use Case 2: Inside the Ropes - Tournament History**
   121→**Goal**: Show year-by-year tournament results at a course
   122→
   123→```typescript
   124→// Step 1: Get all tournament results at this course
   125→const results = await ctx.db
   126→  .query("tournamentResults")
   127→  .withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", scottieId))
   128→  .filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("course"), "TPC Scottsdale"))
   129→  .collect();
   130→
   131→// Returns: [{ year, tournament, position, scores: ["69","72","68","70"], toPar, earnings }]
   132→```
   133→
   134→**Why this table?** Historical tournament-level data with scores array.
   135→
   136→### **Use Case 3: Split Stats - Round-Level Analysis**
   137→**Goal**: Show Thu/Fri vs Sat/Sun, AM vs PM tee time splits
   138→
   139→```typescript
   140→// Step 1: Get all individual rounds
   141→const rounds = await ctx.db
   142→  .query("roundStats")
   143→  .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
   144→    q.eq("playerId", scottieId).eq("courseId", tpcScottsdaleId)
   145→  )
   146→  .collect();
   147→
   148→// Returns: [
   149→//   { round: 1, score: 69, toPar: -2, teeTime: "AM" },
   150→//   { round: 2, score: 72, toPar: +1, teeTime: "PM" },
   151→//   ...
   152→// ]
   153→
   154→// Step 2: Calculate splits
   155→const thuFri = rounds.filter(r => r.round === 1 || r.round === 2);
   156→const satSun = rounds.filter(r => r.round === 3 || r.round === 4);
   157→const amRounds = rounds.filter(r => r.teeTime === "AM");
   158→const pmRounds = rounds.filter(r => r.teeTime === "PM");
   159→```
   160→
   161→**Why this table?** Round-level granularity with teeTime data.
   162→
   163→### **Use Case 4: Player Profile - Tournament Results**
   164→**Goal**: Show all tournaments for a player in 2024
   165→
   166→```typescript
   167→const results = await ctx.db
   168→  .query("tournamentResults")
   169→  .withIndex("by_player_year", (q) =>
   170→    q.eq("playerId", scottieId).eq("year", 2024)
   171→  )
   172→  .collect();
   173→
   174→// Returns: All 2024 tournaments with positions, scores, earnings
   175→```
   176→
   177→**Why this index?** Optimized for player + year queries (common pattern).
   178→
   179→### **Use Case 5: Tournament Page - Leaderboard**
   180→**Goal**: Show all players' results for 2024 Masters
   181→
   182→```typescript
   183→const leaderboard = await ctx.db
   184→  .query("tournamentResults")
   185→  .withIndex("by_tournament", (q) =>
   186→    q.eq("tournament", "Masters Tournament")
   187→  )
   188→  .filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("year"), 2024))
   189→  .collect();
   190→
   191→// Sort by position
   192→leaderboard.sort((a, b) => {
   193→  const posA = parseInt(a.position.replace(/\D/g, '')) || 999;
   194→  const posB = parseInt(b.position.replace(/\D/g, '')) || 999;
   195→  return posA - posB;
   196→});
   197→```
   198→
   199→---
   200→
   201→## 📇 Complete Index Reference
   202→
   203→### **players**
   204→```typescript
   205→.index("by_name", ["name"])              // Player search
   206→.index("by_world_ranking", ["worldRanking"])  // Rankings page
   207→.searchIndex("search_name", { searchField: "name" })  // Fuzzy search
   208→```
   209→
   210→**When to use**:
   211→- `by_name`: Exact name lookups
   212→- `by_world_ranking`: Rankings leaderboard
   213→- `search_name`: Player search dropdown
   214→
   215→### **tournamentResults**
   216→```typescript
   217→.index("by_player", ["playerId"])                    // All player results
   218→.index("by_player_year", ["playerId", "year"])       // Player results by year
   219→.index("by_tournament", ["tournament"])              // Tournament leaderboard
   220→.index("by_year", ["year"])                          // All results in year
   221→.index("by_player_name", ["playerName"])             // Denormalized name search
   222→```
   223→
   224→**When to use**:
   225→- `by_player`: Player profile, career history
   226→- `by_player_year`: Player stats for specific year
   227→- `by_tournament`: Tournament leaderboard
   228→- `by_year`: Year summary stats
   229→- `by_player_name`: Search without player ID
   230→
   231→### **roundStats**
   232→```typescript
   233→.index("by_player", ["playerId"])                           // All player rounds
   234→.index("by_course", ["courseId"])                           // All course rounds
   235→.index("by_tournament_result", ["tournamentResultId"])      // Rounds for result
   236→.index("by_player_course", ["playerId", "courseId"])        // Player at course
   237→.index("by_year", ["year"])                                 // Rounds in year
   238→```
   239→
   240→**When to use**:
   241→- `by_player_course`: **PRIMARY** for Inside the Ropes split stats
   242→- `by_tournament_result`: Expand single tournament to rounds
   243→- `by_year`: Yearly round analysis
   244→
   245→### **playerCourseStats**
   246→```typescript
   247→.index("by_player", ["playerId"])                    // All player courses
   248→.index("by_course", ["courseId"])                    // All players at course
   249→.index("by_player_course", ["playerId", "courseId"]) // Specific combo
   250→```
   251→
   252→**When to use**:
   253→- `by_player_course`: **PRIMARY** for Inside the Ropes career stats
   254→- `by_course`: Course leaderboard (best avg scores)
   255→
   256→### **courses**
   257→```typescript
   258→.index("by_name", ["name"])  // Course lookup
   259→```
   260→
   261→### **pgaTournaments**
   262→```typescript
   263→.index("by_year", ["year"])                       // Year schedule
   264→.index("by_winner", ["winner_espn_id"])           // Player wins
   265→.index("by_tournament_id", ["tournament_id"])     // Unique lookup
   266→.index("by_year_and_name", ["year", "name"])      // Specific tournament
   267→.index("by_status", ["status"])                   // Completed vs scheduled
   268→```
   269→
   270→---
   271→
   272→## 📊 Data Granularity Guide
   273→
   274→**"Which table should I query?"** - Decision tree:
   275→
   276→```
   277→START: What am I looking for?
   278→
   279→├─ Career stats at a course?
   280→│  └─→ playerCourseStats (pre-aggregated, FASTEST)
   281→│
   282→├─ Single tournament result?
   283→│  └─→ tournamentResults.first() (aggregate score, position, earnings)
   284→│
   285→├─ Tournament history at a course?
   286→│  └─→ tournamentResults.collect() + filter by course
   287→│
   288→├─ Round-by-round breakdown?
   289→│  └─→ roundStats (individual rounds, tee times, detailed stats)
   290→│
   291→├─ Split stats (AM/PM, Thu-Fri/Sat-Sun)?
   292→│  └─→ roundStats (ONLY table with teeTime field)
   293→│
   294→├─ Tournament schedule/winners?
   295→│  └─→ pgaTournaments (schedule 2015-2026)
   296→│
   297→└─ Course information?
   298→   └─→ courses (name, location, par, yardage)
   299→```
   300→
   301→---
   302→
   303→## 🔑 Foreign Key Reference
   304→
   305→| Child Table | Foreign Keys | Parent Tables | Relationship |
   306→|-------------|--------------|---------------|--------------|
   307→| `tournamentResults` | `playerId` | `players` | many-to-one |
   308→| `tournamentResults` | `course` (string) | `courses.name` | many-to-one (loose) |
   309→| `roundStats` | `playerId` | `players` | many-to-one |
   310→| `roundStats` | `courseId` | `courses` | many-to-one |
   311→| `roundStats` | `tournamentResultId` | `tournamentResults` | many-to-one |
   312→| `playerCourseStats` | `playerId` | `players` | many-to-one |
   313→| `playerCourseStats` | `courseId` | `courses` | many-to-one |
   314→| `tournamentCourses` | `courseId` | `courses` | many-to-one |
   315→| `userFollows` | `playerId` | `players` | many-to-one |
   316→| `userFollows` | `userId` | `users` (auth) | many-to-one |
   317→
   318→---
   319→
   320→## ⚠️ Common Mistakes to Avoid
   321→
   322→### ❌ Mistake 1: Querying Wrong Granularity
   323→```typescript
   324→// WRONG: Trying to get round scores from tournamentResults
   325→const rounds = tournamentResults.scores; // ["69", "72", "68", "70"]
   326→// This is aggregate! No tee times, no round metadata
   327→
   328→// RIGHT: Query roundStats for round-level data
   329→const rounds = await ctx.db.query("roundStats")...
   330→```
   331→
   332→### ❌ Mistake 2: Calculating Aggregates from Raw Data
   333→```typescript
   334→// WRONG: Calculating career average from all tournamentResults
   335→const allResults = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults")...
   336→const avg = calculateAverage(allResults); // SLOW, wasteful
   337→
   338→// RIGHT: Use pre-aggregated playerCourseStats
   339→const stats = await ctx.db.query("playerCourseStats")
   340→  .withIndex("by_player_course", ...)
   341→  .first();
   342→// stats.scoringAverage already calculated!
   343→```
   344→
   345→### ❌ Mistake 3: Forgetting courseId Filter
   346→```typescript
   347→// WRONG: Getting ALL player rounds everywhere
   348→const rounds = await ctx.db.query("roundStats")
   349→  .withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", id))
   350→  .collect();
   351→
   352→// RIGHT: Filter by course for Inside the Ropes
   353→const rounds = await ctx.db.query("roundStats")
   354→  .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
   355→    q.eq("playerId", id).eq("courseId", courseId)
   356→  )
   357→  .collect();
   358→```
   359→
   360→### ❌ Mistake 4: Using Wrong Index
   361→```typescript
   362→// WRONG: Full table scan to find player's 2024 results
   363→const results = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults")
   364→  .filter((q) =>
   365→    q.eq(q.field("playerId"), id).eq(q.field("year"), 2024)
   366→  )
   367→  .collect();
   368→
   369→// RIGHT: Use composite index
   370→const results = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults")
   371→  .withIndex("by_player_year", (q) =>
   372→    q.eq("playerId", id).eq("year", 2024)
   373→  )
   374→  .collect();
   375→```
   376→
   377→---
   378→
   379→## 📝 Data Denormalization
   380→
   381→**Fields duplicated for performance** (avoid joins):
   382→
   383→### **tournamentResults**
   384→- `playerName` (from `players.name`) - Display without join
   385→- `course` (from `courses.name`) - Filter without join
   386→
   387→**Why?** Leaderboards need player names frequently. Querying 100+ players.name individually would be slow.
   388→
   389→### **roundStats**
   390→- None currently - all relationships via IDs
   391→
   392→---
   393→
   394→## 🎨 Common Query Examples
   395→
   396→### Example 1: Inside the Ropes - Full Player Profile
   397→```typescript
   398→export const getInsideTheRopesData = query({
   399→  args: {
   400→    playerId: v.id("players"),
   401→    courseId: v.id("courses"),
   402→  },
   403→  handler: async (ctx, args) => {
   404→    // 1. Get aggregated career stats (FAST)
   405→    const careerStats = await ctx.db
   406→      .query("playerCourseStats")
   407→      .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
   408→        q.eq("playerId", args.playerId).eq("courseId", args.courseId)
   409→      )
   410→      .first();
   411→
   412→    // 2. Get tournament history (MODERATE)
   413→    const course = await ctx.db.get(args.courseId);
   414→    const tournamentHistory = await ctx.db
   415→      .query("tournamentResults")
   416→      .withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", args.playerId))
   417→      .filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("course"), course!.name))
   418→      .collect();
   419→
   420→    // 3. Get round-level data for splits (FUTURE)
   421→    const rounds = await ctx.db
   422→      .query("roundStats")
   423→      .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
   424→        q.eq("playerId", args.playerId).eq("courseId", args.courseId)
   425→      )
   426→      .collect();
   427→
   428→    return {
   429→      careerStats,      // Aggregated
   430→      tournamentHistory, // Tournament-level
   431→      rounds,           // Round-level (when populated)
   432→    };
   433→  },
   434→});
   435→```
   436→
   437→### Example 2: Calculate Split Stats
   438→```typescript
   439→export const getPlayerSplitStats = query({
   440→  args: {
   441→    playerId: v.id("players"),
   442→    courseId: v.id("courses"),
   443→  },
   444→  handler: async (ctx, args) => {
   445→    const rounds = await ctx.db
   446→      .query("roundStats")
   447→      .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
   448→        q.eq("playerId", args.playerId).eq("courseId", args.courseId)
   449→      )
   450→      .collect();
   451→
   452→    // Calculate splits
   453→    const thuFri = rounds.filter(r => r.round === 1 || r.round === 2);
   454→    const satSun = rounds.filter(r => r.round === 3 || r.round === 4);
   455→    const amWave = rounds.filter(r => r.teeTime === "AM");
   456→    const pmWave = rounds.filter(r => r.teeTime === "PM");
   457→
   458→    const avg = (arr: typeof rounds) =>
   459→      arr.reduce((sum, r) => sum + r.score, 0) / arr.length;
   460→
   461→    return {
   462→      thursdayFriday: { avg: avg(thuFri), rounds: thuFri.length },
   463→      saturdaySunday: { avg: avg(satSun), rounds: satSun.length },
   464→      amWave: { avg: avg(amWave), rounds: amWave.length },
   465→      pmWave: { avg: avg(pmWave), rounds: pmWave.length },
   466→      earlyWeekendDiff: avg(thuFri) - avg(satSun),
   467→      amPmDiff: avg(amWave) - avg(pmWave),
   468→    };
   469→  },
   470→});
   471→```
   472→
   473→---
   474→
   475→## 🚀 Performance Tips
   476→
   477→### 1. Always Use Indexes
   478→```typescript
   479→// ❌ BAD: Full table scan
   480→.filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("playerId"), id))
   481→
   482→// ✅ GOOD: Use index
   483→.withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", id))
   484→```
   485→
   486→### 2. Limit Result Sets
   487→```typescript
   488→// ❌ BAD: .collect() on large table
   489→const allResults = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults").collect();
   490→
   491→// ✅ GOOD: .take(limit) with reasonable limit
   492→const results = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults").take(100);
   493→```
   494→
   495→### 3. Use Pre-Aggregated Tables
   496→```typescript
   497→// ❌ BAD: Calculate from raw data every time
   498→const allRounds = await ctx.db.query("roundStats")...
   499→const avgScore = calculateAverage(allRounds);
   500→
   501→// ✅ GOOD: Use playerCourseStats
   502→const stats = await ctx.db.query("playerCourseStats")...
   503→// stats.scoringAverage already computed
   504→```
   505→
   506→### 4. Collect Only When Safe
   507→Safe to use `.collect()`:
   508→- `players` (200 records, indexed)
   509→- `courses` (54 records)
   510→- `by_player` queries on `tournamentResults` (~200-500 per player)
   511→- `by_player_course` queries on `roundStats` (bounded by player + course)
   512→
   513→NOT safe to use `.collect()`:
   514→- All `tournamentResults` (20K+ records)
   515→- All `roundStats` (future: 80K+ records)
   516→
   517→---
   518→
   519→## 📅 Schema Version History
   520→
   521→**Current Version**: 1.0 (January 2025)
   522→
   523→**Recent Changes**:
   524→- Added `roundStats` table (schema defined, data pending)
   525→- Added `courses`, `tournamentCourses`, `playerCourseStats` tables
   526→- Added `by_player_course` composite indexes
   527→- Added `teeTime` field to `roundStats` for AM/PM splits
   528→
   529→**Pending**:
   530→- Populate `roundStats` with historical round data
   531→- Add tee time data from ESPN/PGA Tour API
   532→- Add weather conditions to `roundStats`
   533→
   534→---
   535→
   536→## 🔄 Data Flow Summary
   537→
   538→```
   539→ESPN/PGA Tour API
   540→        ↓
   541→Import Scripts (Python/JS)
   542→        ↓
   543→┌───────────────────────┐
   544→│  RAW DATA LAYER       │
   545→│  - tournamentResults  │ ← Single tournament, aggregate scores
   546→└───────────────────────┘
   547→        ↓
   548→┌───────────────────────┐
   549→│  DETAILED DATA LAYER  │
   550→│  - roundStats         │ ← Round-by-round, tee times, conditions
   551→└───────────────────────┘
   552→        ↓
   553→┌───────────────────────┐
   554→│  AGGREGATED LAYER     │
   555→│  - playerCourseStats  │ ← Career stats (calculated via mutation)
   556→└───────────────────────┘
   557→        ↓
   558→Inside the Ropes UI
   559→```
   560→
   561→**Key Insight**: Data exists at 3 layers. Query the appropriate layer for your use case.
   562→
   563→---
   564→
   565→## 📞 When to Update This Document
   566→
   567→Update DATABASE_MAP.md when you:
   568→- ✅ Add a new table
   569→- ✅ Add a new index
   570→- ✅ Change a relationship
   571→- ✅ Add a new query pattern
   572→- ✅ Discover a common mistake to avoid
   573→
   574→**This is a living document** - keep it in sync with schema changes!
   575→
   576→---
   577→
   578→**Last Updated**: January 2025
   579→**Maintained By**: Development Team
   580→**Schema File**: `convex/schema.ts`
   581→

# GolfGod Database Relationship Map

**Single Source of Truth** for database schema, relationships, and query patterns.

---

## 🎯 Quick Schema Overview (30 seconds)

```
Players (200) → Tournament Results (20K+) → Round Stats (future)
   ↓                    ↓                        ↓
   └─────────→ Player Course Stats (aggregated career data)
                        ↑
Courses (54) ──────────┘
```

**Key Principle**: Data exists at 3 levels of granularity
1. **Raw** → `tournamentResults` (single tournament, aggregate score)
2. **Detailed** → `roundStats` (individual rounds with tee times)
3. **Aggregated** → `playerCourseStats` (career stats at course)

---

## 📊 Entity Flow Diagram

```
┌─────────┐
│ players │ (200 records)
└────┬────┘
     │
     ├──→ tournamentResults (playerId) [20K+ records]
     │    │
     │    ├─ Stores: year, tournament, position, scores[], toPar, earnings
     │    │
     │    └──→ roundStats (tournamentResultId) [future: 80K+ records]
     │         └─ Stores: round (1-4), score, toPar, teeTime (AM/PM)
     │
     └──→ playerCourseStats (playerId) [2.7K records]
          └─ Stores: AGGREGATED career stats at course

┌─────────┐
│ courses │ (54 records)
└────┬────┘
     │
     ├──→ tournamentCourses (courseId) [mapping table]
     │    └─ Maps: tournamentName ↔ courseId ↔ yearRange
     │
     ├──→ tournamentResults (course field - string)
     │    └─ Links tournaments to courses
     │
     ├──→ roundStats (courseId)
     │
     └──→ playerCourseStats (courseId)
          └─ One record per player-course combination

┌──────────────────┐
│ pgaTournaments   │ (tournament schedule 2015-2026)
└──────────────────┘
     └─ Standalone: Schedule, winners, prize money
```

---

## 🔗 Table Connections (Parent → Child)

### **players**
```
players
├── tournamentResults (FK: playerId)
│   └── Contains: All tournament results for this player
├── roundStats (FK: playerId)
│   └── Contains: All individual rounds played
├── playerCourseStats (FK: playerId)
│   └── Contains: Aggregated stats at each course
└── userFollows (FK: playerId)
    └── Contains: Users following this player
```

### **courses**
```
courses
├── tournamentCourses (FK: courseId)
│   └── Contains: Tournament-to-course mappings
├── tournamentResults (field: course - string match)
│   └── Contains: Results at this course
├── roundStats (FK: courseId)
│   └── Contains: All rounds played at this course
└── playerCourseStats (FK: courseId)
    └── Contains: All player stats at this course
```

### **tournamentResults**
```
tournamentResults
└── roundStats (FK: tournamentResultId)
    └── Contains: Round-by-round breakdown of this result
```

---

## 🎯 Query Patterns by Use Case

### **Use Case 1: Inside the Ropes - Player Course Stats**
**Goal**: Show Scottie Scheffler's career stats at TPC Scottsdale

```typescript
// Step 1: Get aggregated career stats (FASTEST)
const stats = await ctx.db
  .query("playerCourseStats")
  .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
    q.eq("playerId", scottieId).eq("courseId", tpcScottsdaleId)
  )
  .first();

// Returns: { scoringAverage, roundsPlayed, wins, top10s, cutsMade, etc. }
```

**Why this table?** Pre-aggregated career stats, single record, instant response.

### **Use Case 2: Inside the Ropes - Tournament History**
**Goal**: Show year-by-year tournament results at a course

```typescript
// Step 1: Get all tournament results at this course
const results = await ctx.db
  .query("tournamentResults")
  .withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", scottieId))
  .filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("course"), "TPC Scottsdale"))
  .collect();

// Returns: [{ year, tournament, position, scores: ["69","72","68","70"], toPar, earnings }]
```

**Why this table?** Historical tournament-level data with scores array.

### **Use Case 3: Split Stats - Round-Level Analysis**
**Goal**: Show Thu/Fri vs Sat/Sun, AM vs PM tee time splits

```typescript
// Step 1: Get all individual rounds
const rounds = await ctx.db
  .query("roundStats")
  .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
    q.eq("playerId", scottieId).eq("courseId", tpcScottsdaleId)
  )
  .collect();

// Returns: [
//   { round: 1, score: 69, toPar: -2, teeTime: "AM" },
//   { round: 2, score: 72, toPar: +1, teeTime: "PM" },
//   ...
// ]

// Step 2: Calculate splits
const thuFri = rounds.filter(r => r.round === 1 || r.round === 2);
const satSun = rounds.filter(r => r.round === 3 || r.round === 4);
const amRounds = rounds.filter(r => r.teeTime === "AM");
const pmRounds = rounds.filter(r => r.teeTime === "PM");
```

**Why this table?** Round-level granularity with teeTime data.

### **Use Case 4: Player Profile - Tournament Results**
**Goal**: Show all tournaments for a player in 2024

```typescript
const results = await ctx.db
  .query("tournamentResults")
  .withIndex("by_player_year", (q) =>
    q.eq("playerId", scottieId).eq("year", 2024)
  )
  .collect();

// Returns: All 2024 tournaments with positions, scores, earnings
```

**Why this index?** Optimized for player + year queries (common pattern).

### **Use Case 5: Tournament Page - Leaderboard**
**Goal**: Show all players' results for 2024 Masters

```typescript
const leaderboard = await ctx.db
  .query("tournamentResults")
  .withIndex("by_tournament", (q) =>
    q.eq("tournament", "Masters Tournament")
  )
  .filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("year"), 2024))
  .collect();

// Sort by position
leaderboard.sort((a, b) => {
  const posA = parseInt(a.position.replace(/\D/g, '')) || 999;
  const posB = parseInt(b.position.replace(/\D/g, '')) || 999;
  return posA - posB;
});
```

## 📇 Complete Index Reference

### **players**
```typescript
.index("by_name", ["name"])              // Player search
.index("by_world_ranking", ["worldRanking"])  // Rankings page
.searchIndex("search_name", { searchField: "name" })  // Fuzzy search
```

**When to use**:
- `by_name`: Exact name lookups
- `by_world_ranking`: Rankings leaderboard
- `search_name`: Player search dropdown

### **tournamentResults**
```typescript
.index("by_player", ["playerId"])                    // All player results
.index("by_player_year", ["playerId", "year"])       // Player results by year
.index("by_tournament", ["tournament"])              // Tournament leaderboard
.index("by_year", ["year"])                          // All results in year
.index("by_player_name", ["playerName"])             // Denormalized name search
```

**When to use**:
- `by_player`: Player profile, career history
- `by_player_year`: Player stats for specific year
- `by_tournament`: Tournament leaderboard
- `by_year`: Year summary stats
- `by_player_name`: Search without player ID

### **roundStats**
```typescript
.index("by_player", ["playerId"])                           // All player rounds
.index("by_course", ["courseId"])                           // All course rounds
.index("by_tournament_result", ["tournamentResultId"])      // Rounds for result
.index("by_player_course", ["playerId", "courseId"])        // Player at course
.index("by_year", ["year"])                                 // Rounds in year
```

**When to use**:
- `by_player_course`: **PRIMARY** for Inside the Ropes split stats
- `by_tournament_result`: Expand single tournament to rounds
- `by_year`: Yearly round analysis

### **playerCourseStats**
```typescript
.index("by_player", ["playerId"])                    // All player courses
.index("by_course", ["courseId"])                    // All players at course
.index("by_player_course", ["playerId", "courseId"]) // Specific combo
```

**When to use**:
- `by_player_course`: **PRIMARY** for Inside the Ropes career stats
- `by_course`: Course leaderboard (best avg scores)

### **courses**
```typescript
.index("by_name", ["name"])  // Course lookup
```

### **pgaTournaments**
```typescript
.index("by_year", ["year"])                       // Year schedule
.index("by_winner", ["winner_espn_id"])           // Player wins
.index("by_tournament_id", ["tournament_id"])     // Unique lookup
.index("by_year_and_name", ["year", "name"])      // Specific tournament
.index("by_status", ["status"])                   // Completed vs scheduled
```

## 📊 Data Granularity Guide

**"Which table should I query?"** - Decision tree:

```
START: What am I looking for?

├─ Career stats at a course?
│  └─→ playerCourseStats (pre-aggregated, FASTEST)
│
├─ Single tournament result?
│  └─→ tournamentResults.first() (aggregate score, position, earnings)
│
├─ Tournament history at a course?
│  └─→ tournamentResults.collect() + filter by course
│
├─ Round-by-round breakdown?
│  └─→ roundStats (individual rounds, tee times, detailed stats)
│
├─ Split stats (AM/PM, Thu-Fri/Sat-Sun)?
│  └─→ roundStats (ONLY table with teeTime field)
│
├─ Tournament schedule/winners?
│  └─→ pgaTournaments (schedule 2015-2026)
│
└─ Course information?
   └─→ courses (name, location, par, yardage)
```

---

## 🔑 Foreign Key Reference

| Child Table | Foreign Keys | Parent Tables | Relationship |
|-------------|--------------|---------------|--------------|
| `tournamentResults` | `playerId` | `players` | many-to-one |
| `tournamentResults` | `course` (string) | `courses.name` | many-to-one (loose) |
| `roundStats` | `playerId` | `players` | many-to-one |
| `roundStats` | `courseId` | `courses` | many-to-one |
| `roundStats` | `tournamentResultId` | `tournamentResults` | many-to-one |
| `playerCourseStats` | `playerId` | `players` | many-to-one |
| `playerCourseStats` | `courseId` | `courses` | many-to-one |
| `tournamentCourses` | `courseId` | `courses` | many-to-one |
| `userFollows` | `playerId` | `players` | many-to-one |
| `userFollows` | `userId` | `users` (auth) | many-to-one |

## ⚠️ Common Mistakes to Avoid

### ❌ Mistake 1: Querying Wrong Granularity
```typescript
// WRONG: Trying to get round scores from tournamentResults
const rounds = tournamentResults.scores; // ["69", "72", "68", "70"]
// This is aggregate! No tee times, no round metadata

// RIGHT: Query roundStats for round-level data
const rounds = await ctx.db.query("roundStats")...
```

### ❌ Mistake 2: Calculating Aggregates from Raw Data
```typescript
// WRONG: Calculating career average from all tournamentResults
const allResults = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults")...
const avg = calculateAverage(allResults); // SLOW, wasteful

// RIGHT: Use pre-aggregated playerCourseStats
const stats = await ctx.db.query("playerCourseStats")
  .withIndex("by_player_course", ...)
  .first();
// stats.scoringAverage already calculated!
```

### ❌ Mistake 3: Forgetting courseId Filter
```typescript
// WRONG: Getting ALL player rounds everywhere
const rounds = await ctx.db.query("roundStats")
  .withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", id))
  .collect();

// RIGHT: Filter by course for Inside the Ropes
const rounds = await ctx.db.query("roundStats")
  .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
    q.eq("playerId", id).eq("courseId", courseId)
  )
  .collect();
```

### ❌ Mistake 4: Using Wrong Index
```typescript
// WRONG: Full table scan to find player's 2024 results
const results = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults")
  .filter((q) =>
    q.eq(q.field("playerId"), id).eq(q.field("year"), 2024)
  )
  .collect();

// RIGHT: Use composite index
const results = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults")
  .withIndex("by_player_year", (q) =>
    q.eq("playerId", id).eq("year", 2024)
  )
  .collect();
```

---

## 📝 Data Denormalization

**Fields duplicated for performance** (avoid joins):

### **tournamentResults**
- `playerName` (from `players.name`) - Display without join
- `course` (from `courses.name`) - Filter without join

**Why?** Leaderboards need player names frequently. Querying 100+ players.name individually would be slow.

### **roundStats**
- None currently - all relationships via IDs

---

## 🎨 Common Query Examples

### Example 1: Inside the Ropes - Full Player Profile
```typescript
export const getInsideTheRopesData = query({
  args: {
    playerId: v.id("players"),
    courseId: v.id("courses"),
  },
  handler: async (ctx, args) => {
    // 1. Get aggregated career stats (FAST)
    const careerStats = await ctx.db
      .query("playerCourseStats")
      .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
        q.eq("playerId", args.playerId).eq("courseId", args.courseId)
      )
      .first();

    // 2. Get tournament history (MODERATE)
    const course = await ctx.db.get(args.courseId);
    const tournamentHistory = await ctx.db
      .query("tournamentResults")
      .withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", args.playerId))
      .filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("course"), course!.name))
      .collect();

    // 3. Get round-level data for splits (FUTURE)
    const rounds = await ctx.db
      .query("roundStats")
      .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
        q.eq("playerId", args.playerId).eq("courseId", args.courseId)
      )
      .collect();

    return {
      careerStats,      // Aggregated
      tournamentHistory, // Tournament-level
      rounds,           // Round-level (when populated)
    };
  },
});
```

### Example 2: Calculate Split Stats
```typescript
export const getPlayerSplitStats = query({
  args: {
    playerId: v.id("players"),
    courseId: v.id("courses"),
  },
  handler: async (ctx, args) => {
    const rounds = await ctx.db
      .query("roundStats")
      .withIndex("by_player_course", (q) =>
        q.eq("playerId", args.playerId).eq("courseId", args.courseId)
      )
      .collect();

    // Calculate splits
    const thuFri = rounds.filter(r => r.round === 1 || r.round === 2);
    const satSun = rounds.filter(r => r.round === 3 || r.round === 4);
    const amWave = rounds.filter(r => r.teeTime === "AM");
    const pmWave = rounds.filter(r => r.teeTime === "PM");

    const avg = (arr: typeof rounds) =>
      arr.reduce((sum, r) => sum + r.score, 0) / arr.length;

    return {
      thursdayFriday: { avg: avg(thuFri), rounds: thuFri.length },
      saturdaySunday: { avg: avg(satSun), rounds: satSun.length },
      amWave: { avg: avg(amWave), rounds: amWave.length },
      pmWave: { avg: avg(pmWave), rounds: pmWave.length },
      earlyWeekendDiff: avg(thuFri) - avg(satSun),
      amPmDiff: avg(amWave) - avg(pmWave),
    };
  },
});
```

---

## 🚀 Performance Tips

### 1. Always Use Indexes
```typescript
// ❌ BAD: Full table scan
.filter((q) => q.eq(q.field("playerId"), id))

// ✅ GOOD: Use index
.withIndex("by_player", (q) => q.eq("playerId", id))
```

### 2. Limit Result Sets
```typescript
// ❌ BAD: .collect() on large table
const allResults = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults").collect();

// ✅ GOOD: .take(limit) with reasonable limit
const results = await ctx.db.query("tournamentResults").take(100);
```

### 3. Use Pre-Aggregated Tables
```typescript
// ❌ BAD: Calculate from raw data every time
const allRounds = await ctx.db.query("roundStats")...
const avgScore = calculateAverage(allRounds);

// ✅ GOOD: Use playerCourseStats
const stats = await ctx.db.query("playerCourseStats")...
// stats.scoringAverage already computed
```

### 4. Collect Only When Safe
Safe to use `.collect()`:
- `players` (200 records, indexed)
- `courses` (54 records)
- `by_player` queries on `tournamentResults` (~200-500 per player)
- `by_player_course` queries on `roundStats` (bounded by player + course)

NOT safe to use `.collect()`:
- All `tournamentResults` (20K+ records)
- All `roundStats` (future: 80K+ records)

## 🔄 Data Flow Summary

```
ESPN/PGA Tour API
        ↓
Import Scripts (Python/JS)
        ↓
┌───────────────────────┐
│  RAW DATA LAYER       │
│  - tournamentResults  │ ← Single tournament, aggregate scores
└───────────────────────┘
        ↓
┌───────────────────────┐
│  DETAILED DATA LAYER  │
│  - roundStats         │ ← Round-by-round, tee times, conditions
└───────────────────────┘
        ↓
┌───────────────────────┐
│  AGGREGATED LAYER     │
│  - playerCourseStats  │ ← Career stats (calculated via mutation)
└───────────────────────┘
        ↓
Inside the Ropes UI
```

**Key Insight**: Data exists at 3 layers. Query the appropriate layer for your use case.
